sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The whatdotcolor function is used to determine the color number of the specified pixel. The alternate spelling is whatdotcolour.
sections.text_content: The whatdotcolor function is used to determine the color number of the specified pixel. The alternate spelling is whatdotcolour.
sections.mdown_content: The **whatdotcolor** function is used to determine the color number of the specified pixel. The alternate spelling is **whatdotcolour**.

sections.title: Example
code:
setscreen ( "graphics" )
        var x, y : int := 0
        var dx, dx : int := 1
        loop
            if whatdotcolor ( x, y ) not= 0 then
                sound ( 400, 50 )
            end if
            drawdot ( x, y, 1 )
            x := x + dx
            y := y + dy
            if x = 0 or x = maxx then
                dx := -dx
            end if
            if y = 0 or y = maxy then
                dy := -dy
            end if
        end loop
sections.raw_content: This program draws a line which bounces off the edges of the screen and makes a beep when it finds a pixel that has already been colored.
